api package

Submodules

api.auth module

async api.auth.get_refresh_token(request: Request, db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))[source]

Refresh the access token using a valid refresh token.

Parameters:

  • request – HTTP request object containing the refresh token in cookies

  • db – Database session dependency

Returns:

New access and refresh tokens

Return type:

Token

Raises:

HTTPException – If the refresh token is missing, invalid or expired

async api.auth.login(user: UserCreate, db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))[source]

Authenticate a user and generate access and refresh tokens.

This endpoint validates user credentials and returns JWT tokens for authenticated access.

Parameters:

  • user – User credentials with email and password

  • db – Database session dependency

Returns:

Object containing access_token, refresh_token and token_type

Return type:

Token

Raises:

HTTPException – If authentication fails

async api.auth.read_me(request: Request, x_test: str = Header(None), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))[source]

Get information about the currently authenticated user.

This endpoint returns the profile information of the authenticated user. In test mode, it returns a fixed test user.

Parameters:

  • request – HTTP request object

  • x_test – Test header flag

  • current_user – Current authenticated user fetched from token

Returns:

User profile information

Return type:

UserResponse

async api.auth.register_user(body: UserCreate, db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))[source]

Register a new user.

This endpoint creates a new user with the provided credentials and sends a verification email to validate the user’s email address.

Parameters:

  • body – User creation data including username, email and password

  • db – Database session dependency

Returns:

The created user data

Return type:

UserResponse

Raises:

HTTPException – If the email is already registered or if there’s a database error

async api.auth.request_reset_password(email: str = Body(PydanticUndefined), db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))[source]

Request a password reset link.

This endpoint generates a password reset token and sends it to the user’s email.

Parameters:

  • email – User’s email address

  • db – Database session dependency

Returns:

Success message

Return type:

dict

Raises:

HTTPException – If the user is not found

async api.auth.reset_password(token: str, new_password: str = Form(PydanticUndefined), db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))[source]

Reset a user’s password using a valid reset token.

Parameters:

  • token – Password reset token

  • new_password – New password to set

  • db – Database session dependency

Returns:

Success message

Return type:

dict

Raises:

HTTPException – If the reset token is invalid or expired

async api.auth.show_reset_form(request: Request, token: str, db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))[source]

Show the password reset form.

This endpoint renders an HTML form that allows users to reset their password.

Parameters:

  • request – HTTP request object

  • token – Password reset token

  • db – Database session dependency

Returns:

HTML template for password reset

Return type:

HTMLResponse

Raises:

HTMLResponse – With 404 status if token is invalid

async api.auth.test_me()[source]

Test route to get fixed user information without authentication.

This endpoint is used for testing purposes and returns a predefined user.

Returns:

Fixed test user data

Return type:

UserResponse

async api.auth.update_avatar(file: UploadFile = File(PydanticUndefined), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user), db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))[source]

Update the user’s avatar image.

This endpoint allows admin users to upload a new avatar image.

Parameters:

  • file – Uploaded image file

  • current_user – Current authenticated user

  • db – Database session dependency

Returns:

Object containing the URL of the uploaded avatar

Return type:

dict

Raises:

HTTPException – If the user is not an admin or if the file type is invalid

async api.auth.verify_email(token: str, db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))[source]

Verify a user’s email address using the verification token.

Parameters:

  • token – Verification token sent to the user’s email

  • db – Database session dependency

Returns:

Success message if verification is successful

Return type:

dict

Raises:

HTTPException – If the verification token is invalid
